p: Clinical manifestations of CHIK are variable, ranging from asymptomatic infection in a minority of patients to severe crippling debilitating illness. Manifestations are often of acute onset, developing after an incubation period of 4–7 (range 2–12) days. The disease is self-limiting in the majority of patients, with the symptoms disappearing within 7–10 days. Viraemia may persist for 5 days from the onset of symptoms [ 27].
